segments.advisor_message: So, uh, if you look at your, uh, current mortgage statement, you'll see, like, the loan-to-value ra- ratio, which is important for, like, your equity, you know?
segments.client_message: Wait, what’s loan-to-value ratio? I don't get that whole mortgage thing.

segments.advisor_message: Right, so loan-to-value ratio, it's basically, um, how much you owe on your mortgage compared to how much, uh, your property’s worth, kinda like a percentage, you know?
segments.client_message: Ohh, got it! So, if I own a house, and it’s worth 200 grand, andI owe 150, is that like 75%?

segments.advisor_message: Exactly! You got it! So that's, that's good, it means you're, uh, building equity!
segments.client_message: Nice! I think I feel better about my, um, ownership thing now. Just to be clear, uh, my house is in Durham, right?
